sen.j: 天苗加命または天苗益命（あめのなえますのみこと）は日本神話の神 (神道)である。
sen.e: Amanonaemasu-no-mikoto (spelled '天苗加命,' or alternatively '天苗益命') is a deity (Shinto) in Japanese mythology.
Amanonaemasu-no-mikoto (spelled '天苗加命,' or alternatively '天苗益命') is a deity (Shinto) in Japanese mythology.
Amenonaemasu no mikoto (spelled '天苗加命,' or alternatively '天苗益命') is a deity (Shinto) in Japanese mythology.

sen.cmt: 朝彦命 読み方不明
sen.e: He is also known as Asahiko no mikoto.

sen.j: 国譲り神話（葦原中国平定）で有名な経津主神の兄とも子とも伝えられている。
sen.e: It is said that Amanonaemasu-no-mikoto is the brother or father of Futsunushi no kami, who is famous for the legend of "Kuniyuzuri" (transfer of the land, or the pacification of Ashihara no Nakatsukuni (the Central Land of Reed Plains)).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It is said that Amanonaemasu-no-mikoto is the brother or father of Futsunushi no kami, who is famous for the legend of "Kuniyuzuri" (transfer of the land, or the pacification of Ashihara no Nakatsukuni (the Central Land of Reed Plains)).

It is said that Amenonaemasu no mikoto is the brother or son of Futsunushi no kami, who is famous for the legend of Kuniyuzuri (transfer of the land, or the pacification of Ashihara no Nakatsukuni (the Central Land of Reed Plains)).
sen.cmt: スペルハイフン削除father→son"削除

sen.j: 香取神宮の神職首座（大宮司、大禰宜）を代々つとめる香取連の祖で、香取神宮の摂社の一つ、又見神社（または、若御児神社ともいう）に祭られている。
sen.e: Amanonaemasu-no-mikoto is the founding father of Katori-muraji, a family who had served as the head Shinto priest (called 'Daiguji' (high priest of a great shrine), or 'Onegi') of Katori-jinja Shrine for generations, and enshrined in Matami-jinja Shrine (also referred to as 'Wakaomi-jinja Shrine'), one of "sessha" (auxiliary shrines) of Katori-jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: 又見神社、若御児神社 読み方不明 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Amanonaemasu-no-mikoto is the founding father of Katori-muraji, a family who had served as the head Shinto priest (called 'Daiguji' (high priest of a great shrine), or 'Onegi') of Katori-jinja Shrine for generations, and enshrined in Matami-jinja Shrine (also referred to as 'Wakaomi-jinja Shrine'), one of "sessha" (auxiliary shrines) of Katori-jinja Shrine.

Amenonaemasu no mikoto is the founding father of Katori-muraji, a family who had served as the head Shinto priest (called 'Daiguji' (high priest of a great shrine), or 'Onegi') of Katori-jinja Shrine for generations, and enshrined in Matami-jinja Shrine (also referred to as Wakaomi-jinja Shrine), one of sessha (auxiliary shrines) of Katori-jinja Shrine.
